bug.author: jlewi
bug.summary: [GCP] gcloud build submit error when using VPC
bug.description:
I ran into the following problem when trying to use GCB with VPC Service controls to mirror Kubeflow images. The job succeeds but gcloud returns an error which is confusing. Creating this issue to follow up on it. It is likely user error on my part. I have a project in which I created a perimeter with Google Cloud Storage and BigQuery. I'm trying to use Google Cloud Build to mirror images into GCR from outside the perimeter. I created an access level to grant the cloud build service account access to the perimeter: When I try to submit a GCB job I get a security perimeter violation error ERROR: (gcloud.builds.submit) HTTPError 403: SecurityPolicyViolatedRequest violates VPC Service Controls. Request is prohibited by organization's policy
The GCB job succeeds though and images are pushed. So the issue appears to be with gcloud trying to get and report status information. So I added my username to the access levels in order to give gcloud permission. Any idea what the issue might be here? Here's my perimeter name: accessPolicies/216264525333/servicePerimeters/KubeflowZone status: accessLevels:
accessPolicies/216264525333/accessLevels/cloudbuild resources: projects/235037502967 restrictedServices: bigquery.googleapis.com storage.googleapis.com containerregistry.googleapis.com unrestrictedServices: '*' title: Kubeflow Zone
gcloud beta access-context-manager levels describe --policy=${POLICYID} cloudbuild basic: conditions:

user:jlewi@kubeflow.org user:jlewi@google.com serviceAccount:235037502967@cloudbuild.gserviceaccount.com name: accessPolicies/216264525333/accessLevels/cloudbuild title: Cloud Build
